implementation.statement: CRIS restricts access from mobile devices through managed device policies enforced by MDM. Only government-issued, encrypted mobile devices with VPN and MFA are authorized for access.
MFA is required for all user access via Okta. Federal users must authenticate using a PIV card and a unique PIN, fulfilling NIST MFA requirements.
Remote access requires an additional authentication factor beyond username and password, including biometrics or OTPs delivered via secure channels.
Access to privileged accounts requires MFA and an additional out-of-band confirmation step before session start, logged and monitored.
Remote administrative access is gated through jump servers requiring PIV authentication and Okta push approval. No direct access to backend infrastructure is allowed.
User identifiers and authentication tokens are protected in transit and at rest using FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic protocols.
Cryptographic key establishment in CRIS uses AWS KMS with secure key exchange algorithms including ECC and RSA, validated per FIPS 140-2.
Sensitive PII and authentication data are encrypted using AES-256 with envelope encryption in S3. Keys are rotated annually.
Digital information is protected using encryption, DLP tagging, and role-based access restrictions. All data handling complies with FISMA Moderate standards.
Malware protection is automated using CrowdStrike Falcon. Signature updates are applied daily, and scans run continuously on all endpoints.
